That's a great idea! Habit tracker apps can be very effective in helping you stay on track and build consistent habits. Since you've had success with it in the past, it's likely to work well for tracking your social media usage too.

Setting reminders on your phone is also a great way to ensure you regularly check your progress and make adjustments as needed. It's easy to get caught up in daily life and forget to monitor your habits, so reminders can be a helpful nudge to stay on track.

Remember to also reflect on why you're reducing your social media usage and what you hope to achieve. This will help you stay motivated and focused on your goals. Ask yourself questions like:

* What do I want to achieve by reducing my social media usage?
* How will my life improve if I'm more mindful of my social media habits?
* What are the benefits I'm hoping to gain from this change?

Reflecting on your why and your goals will help you stay committed to your new habits and make it more likely that you'll succeed in reducing your social media usage.

Additionally, you might want to consider setting up a reward system for yourself when you reach certain milestones. This could be something small like treating yourself to a favorite coffee or activity, or something bigger like planning a fun outing or weekend getaway. Having something to look forward to can be a great motivator!

How do you think you'll handle situations where you feel the urge to mindlessly scroll through social media, such as during breaks at work or when waiting in line? Do you have any strategies in place to cope with those moments?
